Eh... I almost left a negative review, barely convinced myself not to do that.

The good - incredible idea, lot's of fun, a lot of great and fun mechanics, awesome experience with my friends. This game has SO MUCH going for it, it's incredible! There are lots of fun chases, close calls, teabagging and sneaky actions. You need good teamwork on every step. Perks are diversified and nicely balanced (well.. mostly, except that recently every killer just plays ruin), which allows you to create cool builds and level up[ your trolling game.

The bad - some mechanics are so broken they barely make any sense (wiggle wiggle). There is not enough punishment for being a d*** - facecamping for example. As a killer you can just facecamp someone (what's the point of playing this game at all then?), but as a survivor you can't sit indefinitely in some wardrobe, because of course you will get AFK crows over your head and send visual/sound cues to killer. Talk about equality.

The ugly - oh boy, THE HITBOXES. Don't even get me started on that... just get used to getting stabbed in your a** after vaulting through a window and starting to run. In Dead by Deadlight, even a kitchen knife is a 4 meters long spear. And the second worst thing is how product management of this game takes decisions, destroying UI and various mechanics. The worst change they ever did for me was forcing a close zoom on your character, I am feeling nauseous since they changed that. Please stop making it even worse..

Female characters have nice grunts BTW.. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) - at least until they get you killed.

This game used to be fun. 470 hours of gameplay and all the truth i can give you is this; this game and it's developers favor heavily into the survivor community so if you plan on playing solely survivor great spend your money. if you plan on playing as a killer main don't waste your money. Any perk metas that killers get that can easily deal with a 'survive with friends' group will get nerfed into the ground. The devs don't care about both communities, they care about what makes the game easier for survivors and pushing out micro-transaction cosmetics. 

The survive with friends system was a great concept but only at it's base, unfortunately the devs do nothing to block outside communication services like discord which renders a good portion of killer powers, perks and other things virtually useless. It breaks the matchmaking system when all that's needed is a rank 12 survivor to host his 1,2,3 and 4th rank friends and a helpless new killer is matched with players he has no chance against. The player base, largely survivors, is incredibly toxic and will bully new killers and those unfortunate enough to go against a Survive with friends group (which is 8 out of 10 queues).

That being said there are negative aspects to the killer community. Most of the Killer community play with respect i.e. not tunneling or camping or proxy camping. However this is not the case for all of them, new killers and some higher ranked killers will tunnel and camp but that usually only results in successfully hooking and sacrificing 1 out of 4 survivors while the others gen rush and escape. 

A positive note is the recent UI changes are map changes are sleek and much needed but the visual aesthetic of the game is not enough to outweigh the massive cons of the game. it is my hope that eventually the devs start hearing the pleas of both player bases and constructing content that makes the game fun for both sides again instead of just listening to survivor mains who lose a friend during a match and claim a killer is overpowered.

Used to play this game a lot and thought I would try to get back into it. The same problem they had since a year or two ago: 90% of new perks are just gimmicky and there is no point to running them and every match pretty much plays the same way. Behaviors best bet is to sell the game to a company and dev team that would actually know what do to with the game

that being said, get the game if you are willing to grind hours to get the cool perks the youtubers use. This game will take at least 50-60 hours to get even a couple of those broken survivor or killer perks you see youtubers and streamers use, so if you are willing to drop 50-60 hours just to get another 50-100 hours of somewhat enjoyable playtime and then get bored then buy it

TLDR: If you are willing to drop almost 100 hours into getting all of the good perks for either killer or survivor and then deal with bugs, glitches, terrible balancing updates, and one of the most toxic communities in gaming, then sure get the game.

I would not recommend this game to anyone because it is full of millions of bugs. Mistakes are never fixed. The graphic look and engine are reworked but the flaws in the game are never fixed. For example, the hit box system is a disaster. There are times when several meters are missing and yet the killer hit Me. This phenomenon is also present in windows and pallets. For years, players have been asking for bugs to be fixed, but developers are bringing additional bugs to the game with graphics and other unsolicited content. We think the bugs would be fixed first, mostly the hit box system, not the graphics.
